intro: Hippeastrum lacteum, commonly known as the milk hippeastrum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range from white to pale pink. The plant features strap-shaped leaves that are typically broad and fleshy, adapted to store water in its native arid environments. Its bulbs are large and underground, serving as storage organs for nutrients. Hippeastrum lacteum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-draining soil with adequate sunlight.
